title: The solution set of the equation |5x-12|=x is what? - Quora
tags: Middle and High School Math Homework Question

response.answer_text: When there is a absolute value symbol, you need to split the problem into two cases. This is because the absolute value could either have positive or negative inside it, and it always outputs positive If [math]5x-12[/math] is positive: [math]5x-12 = x[/math] [math]4x-12=0[/math] [math]4x=12[/math] [math]x=3[/math] If [math]5x-12[/math] is negative: [math]-(5x-12) = x[/math] [math]5x-12 = -x[/math] [math]6x-12=0[/math] [math]6x=12[/math] [math]x=2[/math] Whenever you deal with absolute values, its a good idea to check your solution, in case some of them are extraneous [math]|5(3)-12| = (3)[/math] [math]|15-12|=3[/math] [math]|3|=3[/math] [math]3=3[/math] Which is true, so [math]x = 3[/math] is a solution [math]|5(2)-12| = (2)[/math] [math]|10-12| = 2[/math] [math]|-2| = 2[/math] [math]2 = 2[/math] Which is true, so [math]x = 2[/math]Therefore, [math]x = 2, 3[/math] is the solution set to [math]|5x-12|=x[/math]
2 Cases  Check if it satisfies the condition assumed  2.   Always check whether condition assumed is satisfied or not  So, x=2,3 are the solutions
